title: Survey report for removal of tree

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Would you please provide a copy of the survey report that refers to the cherry tree on the grass verge next to number 38 King ecgbert Road. I've already spoken to  AMEYs on this subject and they have given me a reference number 101002615053. They have refused to provide me with the information stating I should make my requests to the City Council. The tree is marked for removal, I wish to understand the reasons for its removal. If this information is available elsewhere can you please let me know exactly where it is available
Yours faithfully,
M Shaw

Re – Freedom of Information Request – Reference – FOI / 2049
Dear Mark Shaw
Thank you for your recent request for information relating to Removal
reasons/ survey report for tree on King Ecgbert Road which we received on
23/05/2016
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request, and will be
dealt with under the Freedom of Information Act.  The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act states that we must respond to you within
20 working days, therefore, you should expect to hear a response from us
by 21/06/2016.
In the meantime, if you have any queries please contact us on the number
below.
Thank you.
Yours sincerely,

Re – Freedom of Information Request – Reference – FOI / 2049
Dear Mark Shaw
Thank you for your recent request for information relating to Removal
reasons/ survey report for tree on King Ecgbert Road which we received on
23/05/2016
Please find below, Sheffield City Council’s response to your request:
We do not have a formal survey report to send out to you as our tree
inspectors only record the findings of their inspections. In this
particular case, the inspector recorded that the kerbs around the tree
were displaced to such an extent that they could not be replaced without
seriously damaging the tree and that a third party wall may be affected.
On this basis, he recommended that the tree should be replaced.
I hope the information we have provided is of help to your enquiries.  If
you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed.  You can ask for an
internal review by either writing to the above address or by emailing
[1][Sheffield City Council request email].
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioners Office. The Information
Commissioner can be contacted at: The Information Commissioner's Office,
Wycliffe House, Water Lane, Wilmslow, Cheshire SK9 5AF, telephone 0303 123
1113, or for further details see their website [2]www.ico.org.uk
Kind Regards,
